course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Hydrosystems Engineering
course.description: This course introduces basic and fundamental knowledge essential to the design and analysis of hydrosystems engineering problems (e,g., water supply, flood control, stormwater drainage, etc.). The course consists of two interrelated parts: hydrology and hydraulics. Hydrology covers various processes of water cycle (including precipitation, infiltration, rainfall-runoff modeling, and flow routings) that produce loads on hydrosystems. Hydraulics, on the other hand, applies fluid mechanics principles to the design and analysis the capacity of hydrosystems infrastructures such as pipe networks and channel networks as well as hydraulic machinery.

reviews.author: BV VT
reviews.title: C－女神呈獻，科大史上最伏科目
reviews.comment_content:
一句講曬：咩都學唔到
人生中最難過的一個course，依家見到R 都驚
有得去exchange 記得搵間可以trans 走呢科的大學

無 Content 可言
留下的只有痛苦的回憶和飽受煎熬的心靈
reviews.comment_teaching:
萌茜教授係科大Academic Achievement Medal（當年以3.97/4 GPA 畢業 ) 個個教授都話佢勁，所以佢會用佢的標準黎教呢科

(PS:我有試圖極專心去上萌茜教授的堂,但無奈係聽極都聽唔明,我都唔知佢果D係咪英文黎)

下年都會係佢教,同學們準備好翻譯蒟蒻上堂LA

個白人，hea 教等走人，唔教功課，堂堂tutorial class 齋企 (走左就唔鬧你)

仲有果2條友都冇傾過點教，可以同時出2份同number 的hw
reviews.comment_grading:
有名你叫C－女神，跟足UG grade distribution 派grade ，派左4成C 同D range，TA 功課，project，take home final 俾分俾到人人接近滿分，冇去take attendance 幾分差距就可以跌一個大grade 由B變C，天怒人怨，有人慘到要係canvas 留言「咩都做齊 結果得個D 係開心既」

利申所有HW Final Above mean : 冇去個19 Quiz: 攞左 C

之後我好言相勸send Email 叫萌茜教授review 下個Grade  ,點知佢理直氣壯企硬,話他自己派grade 好fair ,之後我知佢係真心膠, 寫左12頁紙投訴佢,department 先review 個grade, 之後佢死死地氣話due to overall good performance we reviewed the grade

大家不妨睇下 SFQ response rate 同埋個份就知有幾罄竹難書
大幅拋離前第一 張學清教授

(PS :好似有人仲直接send Email 俾 department head)

( 總之記得上堂做左個quiz 就B range 起跳，冇就準備食C D la)
reviews.comment_workload:
呢一科的workload 大到你唔信，total 6 份功課，3份group 做（自己求其搵條河做），3份individual （reading assignment ,R code) 每一份都要做足我2，3日先做完

Group Whitepaper & Poster；要自己搵題目關水事做paper，唔知咩黎 ) 冇guide line，仲衰過做lang paper咁，又要設計poster 又要presentation

attendance : 有幾堂lib session 要take attendance ，仲冇啦啦加左個pop up quiz ( 決定生死的quiz)

Take Home Final: Prof lu 的水平就concentrated 做 5個鐘就做完，我們就做足三日由朝早做到夜晚，要估pattern 好似做奧數咁

reviews.author: J.Henderson
reviews.title: LU MENGQIAN PLEASE DON'T TEACH ANYMORE
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches hydraulics and hydrology, which have no relationship at all from what I observe throughout this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Koen's teaching is just fine, not very bad but I cannot say he's enthusiastic.

On the other hand, Prof Lu is much worse than Koen. To be frank, she's the worst lecturer I've ever seen (even worse than Lee Wing Lung who teaches math2350). I bet most of the students don't know what she is saying in the lectures, and therefore the attendance was really low. Instead of considering how to improve her teaching, she chose to "threaten" us by sending an email and bringing a name list to ask people questions WITH OUR PHOTOS ON IT!!

To Professor Lu if you are watching this: PLEASE DON'T TEACH UNDERGRADUATE COURSES ANYMORE. JUST PLAY WITH R IN YOUR RESEARCH AND STOP CAUSING PAIN TO US.
reviews.comment_grading: Most students get similar scores in the assignments, project and take home exam, so a few percent difference in the overall score can already make a change with a few sub grades. Then there is this ONE AND ONLY "bonus" class quiz which we were never informed of beforehand. It can add 5% max to the overall score, so basically you're fucked up if you didn't go to attend the bonus quiz. At first she distributed the grades according to the university guidelines WITHOUT CONSIDERING HOW NARROW OUR OVERALL SCORE RANGE IS. Most of us are so pissed off that we complained to the department and luckily they conducted a grade review for all students.
reviews.comment_workload:
For the hydraulics part, there are 4 group assignments which require us to find a river and do some related calculations. Koen was not helpful at all and we have to find the TAs in order to know how to finish the assignments. Most of them are very time consuming.

For the hydrology part, it is a total nightmare. The way how that woman designs her part is just purely awful. I don't fucking know what's the point of designing a POSTER in an engineering course. The whole purpose of doing a project is just error 404 except putting more workload on yr 3 students who are already on the brink of mental breakdown. In the end our group just handed in some shit mostly without using any specific knowledge taught specifically in this course, and finally got above mean for the project. Best joke ever. She also gave us an R assignment which is a total nightmare to us. Maybe she thought we can change from complete BEGINNERS to EXPERTS in R within a very short period of time. Unfortunately, most of us are not as genius and enlightened as she is, so I guess everyone is just "making reference" to the codes from each other and changing variable names.

The final exam creates the worst nightmare I have encountered during my three years of study in HKUST. That woman said we should be able to finish it within 5 hours. In the end most of us used three days to do it. The questions are extremely troublesome and time consuming , e.g. we have to input a 10*7 matrix (which means there are 70 entries) in R. I nearly collapsed after working until 3-4 am for two consecutive nights because of this fucking piece of shit.

To put it simple, the workload from this course is a major source of my stress in this semester, where I already have 11 fucking labs to do.

(P.S. you may notice how many times I have used the word "nightmare". I think you can already imagine how terrible this course is)

reviews.author: CIVIL傻子
reviews.title: Rubbish Prof Lu
reviews.comment_content: This course is about hydrology and hydraulics, two instructors taught one of the two parts. However, the second-half part of the course, Prof. Lu mainly focused on the computation of a software called R. The teaching direction is out of my expectation. I'm sure that most of the students only learnt a little about hydrology and hydraulics in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
During the semester, Prof. Koen resigned. He is a bad teacher as he delivered his ideas unclearly, it is difficult to follow him. Also, in the tutorial session, he only shown the questions of assignments with the projector without guiding us or explaining the questions. Students felt nervous during the tutorial session.

For Prof. Lu, she is new and not an experienced teacher so she should work hard to make improvement in the future.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not a fair system.

The grading actually based on the following 4 parts:
~Participation
~Assignments
~Poster Design and Presentation
~Final Exam

However, except Participation,
Prof. Lu was giving similar marks for the other 3 parts

Therefore, the participation governs your grade, be aware of the one and the only one pop-up quiz.
That quiz affects your grade a lot.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of this course is really large.

Let's just discuss the workload of Prof. Lu's part is enough:

6 assignments (3 individual, 3 group)
-you need to select a river randomly and do analysis.
1 assignment takes you a minimum of 5 hours to complete.

Poster Design (poster abstract, present session, design, white paper)
-All of these takes your group a total of at least 30 hours to complete within a month)

Final Exam (She gives you 3 days to complete)
It requires your concentrated work of 10 hours per day to complete(A total of 30 hours)

reviews.author: NZ
reviews.title: Pain but No Gain
reviews.comment_content: The course is very disorganized. There is no connection between the two parts of the course (i.e. hydraulics and hydrology) as there is a lack of communication between two professors.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both professors taught in a monotonic way which makes me very difficult to follow what they are actually teaching.

For Prof. Blanckaert (Hydraulics Part), he gave us assignments that had not be taught in class. In his tutorials, he just stand there and ask us to do the assignments ourselves without any instructions. We need to find the TAs many times in order to finish those tedious assignments.

For Prof. Lu (Hydrology Part), as she is very erudite (Academic Role Model,GPA:3.97/4), she uses her "extraordinary mind" to design her very "fruitful" course contents for us. actually teaching for UG students before taking the attendance. Unfortunately, as most of us are not as erudite as Prof. LU , we only want to become a civil engineer and do not have the potentials to become designers, programmers or researchers, we cannot understand the painstaking efforts of Prof. LU for asking us to make a very “interesting” poster and learn those very "useful" R codes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Prof LU gave us grades in a very "fair" way according to the UG Grade Distribution. 40% of us got a C range or below.

Because of this, many students sent email to Prof LU for grade review. At first, Prof LU refused to review the grade and she firmly claimed that her grading is very fair. However, after some students reflected this to the department, she changed her mind and willing to review all the grades again.
reviews.comment_workload:
For hydraulics part, there are total 4 group assignments (3 people in a group). For these assignments, we have to choose a river and do calculations based all the data of this river. As we are only very humble students, we do not have any powerful computer program and cannot ask any organizations to give us any digital data, we have a hard time to find useful information in the internet. Moreover, as he did not teach us how to do all those assignments , we have to spend a lot of time to find the TA to finish the untaught assignments. (One of the assignment in this part had cost us more than “20 hours” to finish!)

For hydrology part, there are total 2 individual assignments (a reading assignment, a R code assignment) , 3 group assignments (6 people in a group) (a poster design, a presentation and a white paper) , attend 2 library workshops a pop-up quiz in the lecture. For the reading assignment, we have to read those lengthy readings to get the answers for finishing the assignments (just like doing English reading comprehension). For the R code assignment, as we are only civil students which do not have rich knowledge in programing like our very erudite Prof. LU (Most of us only know Excel VBA), we have a hardship in understanding all those tedious R codes and need about 3 to 4 days to finish the assignment. For the group assignment, we need to choose any topic about Hydraulics or Hydrology to make a poster first. Then, we need to go to the library to participate an “academic conference”. Half of each group needs to deliver presentations to all the TAs and students in the academic conference and another half need to assess other group’s performance. As there is no guideline, we have to spend a lot of time for design the poster  and organize the presentation. Finally, we have to write a white paper on the chosen topic. We need to follow rubrics similar to the LANG course for doing the white paper (I don’t know why we need to study a LANG course again and also in a more tough way as we have already passed my LANG 2030 in the previous semester). For the library workshops, they are compulsory and attendance is needed. For the pop-up quiz, it contributes much for the final grade, people who miss it may suffer from one grade down (e.g. B range to C range)

In addition, there is a take-home final which includes the contents of both parts. As Prof LU is very "talented", she said she only need 5 hours concentrated works to finish it. Unfortunately, I am only a normal student so I need to spend total 3 days to finish it.

With all these tedious workloads, I only have a little time to spend on other courses which really affect my performances in other courses in this semester.

reviews.author: HKUST-1
reviews.title: A+女神呈獻，科大史上最驚喜科目

但我唔記得點用
所以撻咗個靚q
不過我覺得10個鐘workload有B-真係算係咁

reviews.author: CyrusL
reviews.comment_content:
This course is split into two sections. For this semester, the first half was taught by Prof. Lu and the second half by Prof. Lee.

[Topics Covered]
Part One (Hydrology):
1. Introduction to Hydrosystems Engineering
2. Climate and Hydrologic Cycle
3. Precipitation
-- Quiz 1 (closed-book) --
4. Hydrologic Losses
5. Rainfall-Runoff
6. Routing
--- Midterm Exam (closed-book) ---
Part Two (Hydraulics):
1. Introduction to Hydraulic Engineering
2. Uniform Flow; Critical Flow and Specific Energy
-- Quiz 2 (open-book) --
3. Gradually-varied Flow
4. Transport and Mixing Processes
--- Final Exam (closed-book) ---

The hydrology part is mostly straightforward, though you may have to memorize certain facts for the quiz and midterm. Towards the end, you will have to deal with iterative equations, so having good Excel skills is a plus (you will be asked to fill in the blanks for the midterm).

The hydraulics part is much more difficult than the hydrology part as it relates to fluid mechanics. If you have forgotten the stuff taught in CIVL 2510, better brush up on that after the midterm!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lu has put a lot of effort into her PowerPoint presentations, which makes her teaching much easier to follow. At the start of the course, she mentioned that she would direct questions to random students during lecture time; those who answer a question correctly would get their grade promoted to A- if they would have otherwise gotten a B+. However, she failed to fulfill her promise that every student would be asked at least one question by the end of the course, so it was unfair to those who were unlucky.

Prof. Lee relies heavily on his handwritten notes, though a PowerPoint is provided nonetheless. Also unlike Prof. Lu, he releases exercise questions to help students prepare for the assessments. You should pay attention to the handwritten notes as you may be examined on them, and the content may not be found in the PowerPoint nor the exercises.

After face-to-face sessions were suspended, Prof. Lee remained on schedule by uploading video recordings of his lectures and conducting live tutorials online. The quiz and final exam were also conducted online.
reviews.comment_grading:
The two quizzes cover the first half of the hydrology and hydraulic parts respectively.

The exams are non-cumulative, meaning that the midterm only covers the hydrology part, while the final exam only covers the hydraulic part. However, the final exam has almost double the weight compared to the midterm, so the second half of the course is more important to your grades.

As mentioned in the Teaching section, students who answer Prof. Lu's questions correctly would get their grade promoted to A- (without affecting the grades of other students) if they would have otherwise gotten a B+.

[Grading Scheme]
Quizzes: 20%
Midterm Exam: 30%
Final Exam: 50%

[My Grades (20th, 50th, 80th Percentile)]
Quiz 1: 94/100 (50, 61, 70)
Midterm: 91/100 (68, 80, 92)
Quiz 2: 70/100 (57, 76, 85)
Final Exam: 67/100 (?, 62, ?)
Overall: 77.2% (?, 68.7%, ?)
Did not answer any question from Prof. Lu.

Even though I messed up on the second part, I still got an A- without Prof. Lu's help. This is one of the best gradings I have ever experienced - I doubt that I even got 1 SD above mean.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments nor projects. All you have to do is study for the quizzes and exams.

reviews.author: thanos
reviews.title: Small workload but very good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Know how to use the formulas would be good enough

Tutorial is basically not necessary cuz they provide answers to the practice questions
reviews.comment_grading:
very good grade

65% final

Final grade A+

No presentation
No attendance
Only revise for two exams
Do some practice questions would be sufficient

reviews.author: Sturgeon
reviews.title: Leng grade
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂無聽過書，但係ppt清楚易理解，理解ppt + TWQ已經足夠
Lu好好人，問佢問題都盡力回答，有吾明建議多問

Tutorial主講TWQ solutions，可以skip
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 58/100 (mean 45.8; high 100)
Final: 57/100(mean 45; high 96)
Grade: A

不同往年，今年無MC。

midterm重concept，一定要背曬definition + 理解，有兩題問concept問得非常仔細，佔約莫40分。

final好難，以爲自己會炒粉。TWQ要做曬，有好大幫助
溫書時要清楚自己學緊咩，點解要咁做，融會貫通先係致勝關鍵
Chapter 5 完全唔知學緊咩，偏偏出得最多
reviews.comment_workload:
35% mt
65% final

effort少但leng grade，性價比極高

reviews.author: 準雷
reviews.title: 考試會嚇你一跳 但好靚grade既水course
reviews.comment_content:
此course分為Hydrology同埋Hydraulics兩部份
-----------------Hydrology----------------
---Midterm and Final Exam start from here---
Chapter 1 - Introduction to Hydrosystem Engineering
Chapter 2 - Climate and Hydrologic Cycle
Chapter 3 - Precipitation
Chapter 4 - Hydrologic Losses
----Midterm Exam up to here---
Chapter 5 - Hydrography Analysis - Rainfall
Chapter 6 - Routing
-----------------Hydraulics----------------
Chapter 7 - Open Channel Flow
Chapter 8 - Pressurized Flow
----Final Exam up to here----
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lu既教學好一般
雖然英文水準唔錯
但好多時講既野都比較空泛
會比較難理解佢既重點
需要課後用自己時間睇返notes

Tutorial會係唔同TA
講返Prof. Lu提供既working questions既答案
會幫到自己更加好明白重點
但考試題型可以同tutorial既題目好唔同
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm Exam (Closed-book, 35%):
35/100 (Below mean 0.726 S.D.)
(Mean 45.77, S.D. 14.83)
(Median: 43.75, UQ: 55.38, LQ: 34.5)

Final Exam (Closed-book, 65%):
55/100 (Mean 45.02)
(Median: 42, UQ: 53, LQ: 34)

Overall: 48%
Grade: B+

考試難(主要係題型多變  會令人無所適從)
但grading非常靚
reviews.comment_workload:
無Homework 所以workload比較輕

Midterm Exam背既野都唔算太多
要花時間透徹理解每個concept
同埋睇返tutorial working question點做
因為考試會撈多過一課係同一題到

Final Exam雖然係cumulative
但前4課可以花少D時間
因為佢講到明會集中Midterm後既野
同樣要花時間透徹理解每個concept
同埋睇返tutorial working question點做
尤其是D spreadsheet table點樣填
因為考試會撈多過一課係同一題到

reviews.author: shirayuki653
reviews.title: a so-so course
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a combination of 2 half-semester courses with NO RELATION:hydraulics and hydrology. For hydrology taught by Professor Lu, topics include hydrological cycle, hydrographs, infiltration model, and routing. After midterm, the course is taught by Professor Lee. Hydraulic part includes open channel flow and GVF.

Because of the research area of Professor Lee, environmental hydraulics is included at the last two weeks. This part is difficult conceptually, as PDE stuffs started to appear(though the questions are not hard). However, I think this is the most interesting part in the whole course.

Overall speaking, the first half is not difficult and the second half is a nightmare since concept from fluid mechanics will applied over and over. Moreover, the content is a bit too much, since hydraulic part is simply in a rush.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of Professor Lu is fair. Her lectures are clumped with many extra materials related, but they will not be tested in exams and it is easy to get lost. This part is simply a game of excelling the Excel files from the professor.

On the other hand, teaching of Professor Lee is more clear. However, it is frustrating to read his handwriting on his notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very lenient last year(I saw someone got 2 SD below midterm and final and got B-)However, the overall grading is just normal this year,Mean scores will give a B-/C+.And at the start of the semester,Professor said the mean will be B/B+(??)

Grading scheme, my score, (mean)
Quiz 1(10%):68/100,(60)
Midterm (closed book,30%): 92/100(79)
Quiz 2(10%):77/100(68)
Final 50%(open book and non-cumulative):68/100(62)
Total:76.1/100 and give me a B+.This mean Professor Lu break her promise.
reviews.comment_workload: The good thing is that there are no assignments, but you need to familiarize with the tutorial questions or else you are done in the exams.

reviews.author: 我是學霸ak
reviews.title: C- 女神一雪前恥 愛心爆棚
reviews.comment_content:
原本諗住今個sem又要對住R
唔知係咪上年個SFQ 今年所有content 只係用excel
一開始講下hydrological cycle, history 同埋水利建設
然後係water cycle, Greenhouse
之後就係stats, infiltration, runoff, routing 同埋flows
唔難理解 而且仲有video 輕鬆
reviews.comment_teaching: 英文聽得明嘅 係講野慢啲 建議睇片節省時間 因為都幾容易會訓
reviews.comment_grading:
鬆手
兩個assignments 各佔10%
兩個quizzes 各佔10%
一個mid term 20%
一個final 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
最大workload 係抄cheatsheet.
Your efforts will pay off.

reviews.author: Watermelon
reviews.comment_content:
- Introduction to Hydrosystem Engineering
- Climate and Hydrologic Cycle
- Precipitation
- Hydrologic Losses
- Hydrography Analysis - Rainfall - Runoff
- Routing
- Open Channel Flow - Fundamentals
- Open Channel Flow - Energy
- Pressurized Flow & Stormwater Management
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂嘅人數會越嚟越少，因為講書嘅速度超級超級慢。
每個Chapter都有少少in-class quiz（唔計分），但係只係幫到你確認自己明唔明個concept，對做考試冇咩大作用。
/
所以，其實可以一堂都唔上，然後考試攞70%+ (差唔多到A嘅cutoff)
reviews.comment_workload:
完全冇功課，唔使趕功課趕deadline。
/
Tutorial: 好悶，但係都可以攞Tut啲問題做練習，準備考試。

reviews.author: Jsin973
reviews.comment_content:
This course introduces basic and fundamental knowledge essential to
the design and analysis of hydrosystems engineering problems with the consideration of
climate change. The course consists of two interrelated parts: hydrology and hydraulics,
within the non-negligible scope of climatology. Hydrology covers various processes of
water cycle (including precipitation, infiltration, rainfall-runoff modeling, and flow routings)
that produce loads on hydrosystems. Hydraulics, on the other hand, uses basic principles of
fluid mechanics to the analysis of natural water systems and the design of engineering
structures
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor just read aloud the PowerPoint. TA and tutorial is helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Acceptable grading. I got B and at about mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable workload with one midterm and one final only

reviews.author: NCTROLL
reviews.comment_content:
The content is really interesting and you will never fall asleep.
Ch1.1-1.2 Course syllabus
Ch2.1-2.2 Climate and Hydrologic Cycle
Ch3.1-3.2 Precipitation
Ch4.1 Hydrologic Abstractions
Ch4.2 Horton's Infiltration Models
Ch5.1-5.2 Rainfall-Runoff Process & Modelling (understand how to draw and use the unit hydrograph is important)
Ch6.1 Reservoir Routing
Ch6.2 River Routing
Ch7.0 Hydraulics (introduce the basics of fluid mechanics like Reynold's number)
Ch7.1 Open Channel Flow (learn about manning's equation)
Ch7.2 Energy in Open Channel Flows (study the phenomenon of critical flow, such as hydraulic jump and rise of water depth)
Ch7.3 Pipe Flows (talk about the major energy loss of the flow (Darcy-Weisbach equation) and minor energy loss of the flow)
reviews.comment_teaching: You will understand the logic of the lecture notes if you attend the lessons. However, the teaching style may be a little bit boring as the pace of the lesson is quite slow.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade in this semester should be very good as most of my friends who attained mean can get at least a B.
Statistics:
Midterm: mean 55.2 | s.d. 13.2 | my score 70
Final: mean 46.6 | s.d. not given | my score 48
Final grade: A-
As you can see, I screw up the final exam but still enable to get A-. Hence, the mean grade should be around B.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. No hw and any other annoying stuff. Attendance is needed.

reviews.author: ljdjlalb
reviews.title: Review on 3510
reviews.comment_content:
The content is more similar to earth sciences for hydrology part.

The contents are too shallow for the hydralics part. But, it is understandable as the water engineering is shifting from civil to mae. And it will be pg level if teach in depth.

The entire course is more alike excel 1001 for civil engineering for which is very useful for your future career.
reviews.comment_teaching: Straight forward, passionate teaching, given a wide variaty of additional material.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% A range. Would say it is generous.

For the exam, it is designated in a difficult manner which you are not supposed to finish it so as the others. Focus on manipulating hydrology part and excel operations will get you good scores.

Mid-term: I did not study how to play with excel. Getting a score slighting lower the median. (better study excel, do not act like me)

Final: Basicially gone through all materials Scoing 20 above the median. Tips: Study hard on hydrology as Prof. Lu is an expert in hydrology and so most part of the exam test on your understanding in hydrology

reviews.author: つち
reviews.title: C-女神已蛻變成grade神
reviews.comment_content:
Ch1.1 Introductoin 1
Ch1.2 Introduction 2

Ch2.1 Climate and Hydrologic Cycle 1
Ch2.2 Climate and Hydrologic Cycle 2

Ch3.1 Precipitation - Physical Process
Ch3.2 Precipitation - measurement & calculation

Ch4.1 Hydrologic Abstractions
Ch4.2 Infiltration Models

Ch5.1 Rainfall-Runoff Process & Modelling
Ch5.2 Rainfall-Runoff Process & Modelling II

Ch6.1 Reservoir Routing
Ch6.2 River Routing

Ch7.0 Introduction to Hydraulics
Ch7.1 Open Channel
Ch7.2 Energy in Open Channel Flows
Ch7.3 Pressurized Pipe Flows

(Seems that the content in previous semesters were more complicated)
reviews.comment_teaching:
In this sem, we don't have to touch any programming. Only excel spreadsheets is involved, not even VBA.

Prof. Lu's English is not bad. She explains the concepts well, with examples for us to understand the application of the new concepts.

Her talking speed is a bit slow. It is ok to watch the lecture videos with 2x or even higher speed.

Prof. Lu also provides summaries and highlights of class content in Canvas nearly every week, which are quite helpful for you to check your progress.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance(5%)
Midterm(35%)
Final(60%)
*Golden snitch (In-class questions)
If one can get at least 60% of In-class questions correct, he/she can get the golden snitch.
With golden snitch, if one is top 3 in any grade level, the grade can be bumped to the next higher one (e.g. A- to A)

My performance
Attendance: full
Midterm: around 1.2 s.d. higher than mean  (mean 55.2   s.d. 13.2   low 0   high 84)
Final: just a few marks higher than mean (< 50)  (mean 46.6   s.d. unknown   low 0   high 86.8)
*In-class question: 10/21 (mean 6.7   low 0   high 15.5)
(no golden snitch)

Final grade: A-

Big surprise! Definitely an unforgettable New Year gift. :D
When I looked at my final exam result (60% of course grade...), I thought I am going to get a C range...
reviews.comment_workload:
No Homework No Quiz!

Only Midterm & Final (close-book)

No poster making :D

reviews.author: cheese
reviews.title: improved course
reviews.comment_content:
(Course policy changed in this semester, check the workload section for more) The content includes climate, hydrological cycle, probability, regression, unit hydrograph, infiltration model, open channel and pipe flow.

She always mentioned the reason to teach each topic in a sequence so that we can have a better understanding of the Hydraulics and Hydro system, starting from introduction to serious matters.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In my opinion, the teaching is good as she explained everything clearly with explanation, examples (which will be tested in exams) and she will ask if we have any questions. She also filmed an extra video to clarify a specific topic and gave a midterm review and final review in order to prepare us for them.

The only thing that may be bad is her English skills. Her grammar is wrong in some of the ppt and she doesn't speak English fluently. Some typos in the formulas so you should probably double check the examples before copying any formulas.

You can just skip most of the classes and you will do just fine with her ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is unknown to everyone.
I got 79.84 in total and get an A.
Mean: 68.9 in total (very high as the workload is not too much and the exam/midterm/quizzes are easy)
Mean: 55.1/100 in the exam
10% HW1
10% HW2
10% QUIZ1 (One cheat sheet)
10% QUIZ2 (One cheat sheet)
20% Midterm (One cheat sheet)
40% Final (Two cheat sheet)
reviews.comment_workload: This course was a disaster as mentioned by some last year students. However, this semester, professor Lu has made some revolutionary changes to the course. Instead of six homework, we are reduced to only 2 hw. In total, there are only 2 hw and 2 quizzes where sources and cheatsheet are allowed. No project, no presentation and no attendance. Also, we don't need to memorize much as the quizzes, midterm and exam tested similar questions to the powerpoint, which we should have written in the cheat sheet. The workload of this course is significantly reduced, compared to the previous semester.

reviews.author: Ptan
reviews.comment_content: The content was quite interesting and covered both hydraulics and hydrology. The lecture content covered a lot more than what was required for the exam, and there is a lot of optional background reading if a student is interested in a particular topic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Unfortunately, the professor (A. Jayawardena) made minimal attempts at making the lecture engaging during the whole semester. At the beginning, he simply read aloud word documents with plain text. After some feedback from students sitting in the front rows, he copied and pasted these word documents into powerpoint slides, however, it was often still monotonously read aloud during the lectures. He is, however, happy to answer questions and to talk with students after class, although the vast majority of students quickly got bored of his teaching and never came to class.
It was only at the end of the semester, when he taught 2 lectures which were not included in the final exam, that the teaching became more engaging and he showed more images and supplementary material in class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was quite lenient, as the Professor made the midterm practically the same as the homework he had previously assigned. The final was relatively ok - and it was open book - so as long as you were familiar with where to look for content during the exam (there are a lot of lecture notes that you can print), then you would have done ok.
reviews.comment_workload: If you wanted to follow the lectures and actually understand the material taught, then you would have to put in quite a lot of self-studying time. However, if you want to purely pass the course with minimal studying, it is very much doable as there is only a few small assignments, along with open book midterm and final exams.
